title: Honest John: why must I pay extra after my BMW was recalled due to manufacturing faults?
text:
If your car has developed a fault, or for consumer advice, turn to Honest John by emailing honestadvice@telegraph.co.uk

The X fails

My five-month-old BMW X1 was recalled for two problems. The dealer is 15 miles from my home and requested the car from 9am to 5pm, so proposed supplying me with a courtesy car. What was not mentioned was a £500 liability to be paid for the courtesy car, to cover any damage regardless of whose fault. On payment of £15 the dealer advised the liability would be reduced to £50. As the recall was requested by BMW due to a manufacturing fault, surely I should not be inconvenienced but out of pocket as well? DM
